title: Virtual Lecture: Edgar Heap of Birds
short_description:
Hock E Aye Vi Edgar Heap of Birds (Native American, Cheyenne/Arapaho, b. 1954) is an artist and an advocate for Indigenous communities worldwide. His work includes multidisciplinary forms of public art messages, large-scale drawings, Neuf Series acrylic paintings, prints, works in glass, and monumental porcelain enamel on steel outdoor sculpture. While representing Indigenous communities, his art focuses first on social justice as well as on the personal freedom to live within the tribal circle as an expressive individual. 

Following the lecture a Q&A will be led by Hendrik Folkerts, curator of International Contemporary Art at Moderna Museet, Stockholm.
header_description: Spirit Citizen: Provocative Native American Public Art and Studio Practice
list_description: Presented by the Society for Contemporary Art
description:

Please note that all event times listed are in central time.

Presented by the Society for Contemporary Art
